benchmark_details.name: WikiAtomic
benchmark_details.overview: WikiAtomic is a novel dataset comprised of prompt/response pairs in which provided context is incrementally increased to study how large language models prioritize contextual and parametric knowledge in knowledge-consistent scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate how large language models allocate knowledge between local context and global parameters when answering open-ended questions.

data.source: Wikipedia articles decomposed into atomic sentences.
data.annotation: Manual extraction and verification of atomic sentences.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the overlap between responses and provided contexts, using entailment scores to classify sentences.
methodology.interpretation: A higher FActScore indicates fewer hallucinations and more factually accurate responses.
